title: Aspects between Design for Adaptability and Nature: bioinspiration in ephemeral artifacts
abstract: The contemporary environmental challenge, marked mainly by carbon dioxide emissions into the atmosphere that intensify climate change, has culminated in planetary consequences already considered irreversible. In this sense, this article seeks to emphasize Design for Adaptability (DfAD) as a Biomimicry design practice, through consideration of the life cycle and accommodation to changes.
